title: Cryptic Crossword 12
description: It's been a while since the last addition to this collection. Hopefully my clueing has improved since.

clues.clue: Ledger with a commoner at the top; noble to express disapproval before King.
It doesn’t look so good after it’s been blown up?
Now things get deeper, fish face uncertainty, becoming endangered at first.
Royal Institute bridging gap with talk’s second part: Illustrating Magnetism.
Headwear worn by head of fashion is lacking.
Explosion of growth.
Track technician’s run round cycling god.
Character from Crete after two pieces of cheese from Athens with Hellenic herb.
Support thing on stage.
Witch’s brew recepticle I found in the toilet earlier.
Midfielder becomes hot in friendly game.
Michael Cera’s first misuse of substance.
Vegetables you and I would eat first on board ship.
Test if Royal Variety performer makes noises behind the scenes.
Members of the crew arrived with Japanese food.
Against having part of speech included in newspaper column.
Egyptian god, naked, stands before a land of many pyramids.
He manages 14 stores in America, taking nothing from union leader.
Pacino’s careful holding one of these!
Automatic response to shock when either there is no resistance, or the resistance is lowered immediately.
Unauthorised finale stopped randomly.
Heard story from cleaner.
Take back topless dress worn by a bunch of people.
Rich chocolate sauce odour cleared out to avoid, say, stomach ache.
King beginning to try and sense corruption in parliament.
Primarily over-acting celebrities return to take up fringe characters in movie!
Regularly up for, like, a dance.
